bibl.title: Hecataeus of Abdera and a New Conjecture in Josephus, Contra Apionem 1.189. Avec résumé en anglais.
bibl.note: 1. Hecataeus of Abdera. - 2. Josephus, Contra Apionem 1.189. - 3. Hecataeus' Book. - Proposes a new conjecture in a much-discussed passage, which poses several problems: the precise meaning of a phrase; the historical context of the passage; and its authenticity (that is, whether it is a genuine fragment of the Greek historian Hecataeus of Abdera, as Josephus supposes, but most recent scholarly treatments do not). The passage emerges as containing valuable historical information about the Jewish settlement made by Ptolemy Soter; as illuminating alike Ptolemaic, Greek and Jewish traditions about the history of the Jews under the Ptolemies.
